bug.author: heavycello
bug.summary: pandas_profiling wont work, even after updating
bug.description:
Describe the bug getting error code after ProfileReport was working fine previously.
66 description_set = describe(df, **kwargs)
<denchmark-code> 67 68 self.html = to_html(sample, </denchmark-code>
C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\pandas_profiling\describe.py in describe(df, bins, check_correlation, correlation_threshold, correlation_overrides, check_recoded, pool_size, **kwargs) 390 if name not in names: 391 names.append(name) --> 392 variable_stats = pd.concat(ldesc, join_axes=pd.Index([names]), axis=1) 393 variable_stats.columns.names = df.columns.names 394 TypeError: concat() got an unexpected keyword argument 'join_axes' --> To Reproduce

comments.comment: Hi, i too faced the same issue Regards
Hi, Also running into the same issue. I upgraded to pandas 1.0 yesterday. Likely related.
Same here. I'm also getting the same issue.
For me the same. Pandas 1.0 is installed.
Note that pandas 1.0 is not yet stable and is not supported: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/issues/367#issuecomment-583389681>#367 (comment)</denchmark-link>
how to solve the version betwon pandas and pandas-profiling, this question
It would fix your problem pip3 install pandas_profiling --upgrade Cheers!
